name: specific_humidity
description: specific means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

name: dew_point_depression
description: Dew point depression is also called dew point deficit. It is the amount by which the air temperature exceeds its dew point temperature. Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

name: dew_point_temperature
description: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

name: pressure_tendancy_characteristics
description: characteristic of pressure tendency (used in synoptic maps)

name: air_pressure_at_sea_level
description: sea_level means mean sea level,  which is close to the geoid in sea areas. Air pressure at sea level is the quantity often abbreviated as MSLP or PMSL.

name: air_temperature
description: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air,  not the surface (skin) temperature.

name: water_temperature
description: Water (sea, river, lake) temperature at depth indicated

name: horizontal_visibility_in_air
description: The visibility is the distance at which something can be seen.

name: wind_from_direction
description: direction from which the wind is blowing

name: eastward_wind_speed
description: Eastward indicates a vector component which is positive when directed eastward (negative westward). Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.)

name: northward_wind_speed
description: Northward indicates a vector component which is positive when directed northward (negative southward). Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.)

name: wind_speed
description: Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity.

name: wind_speed_of_gust
description: Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector,  with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity. A gust is a sudden brief period of high wind speed. In an observed timeseries of wind speed,  the gust wind speed can be indicated by a cell_methods of maximum for the time-interval. In an atmospheric model which has a parametrised calculation of gustiness,  the gust wind speed may be separately diagnosed from the wind speed.
